page.title: 02Ormskirk Farmhouses
page.content: Nearly all of the houses in this block are connected with agriculture, being farmhouses or built as cottages for labourers. The names reflect the original owners, or the position they occupy, for example, New Cut Farm, Narrow Lane Farm.. One or two have changed their original purpose, for example, one farmhouse is now used as a Kennels, a labourer's cottage is now used by a craftsman - an engraver. One unusual sight was that of a set of 4 back-to-back cottages over 100 years old, now in the process of being converted into two semi-detatched cottages, the shared back wall being removed. The back-to-back house is usually associated with development in industrial towns.
